Weather forecast

This component demonstrates fetching data from the server.

{{encodedResult}}

{{res}}

Loading...

Date Temp. (C) Temp. (F) Summary
{{ forecast.date }} {{ forecast.temperatureC }} {{ forecast.temperatureF }} {{ forecast.summary }}
import { ChangeDetectionStrategy, ChangeDetectorRef, Component, Inject } from '@angular/core'; import { HttpClient, HttpDownloadProgressEvent, HttpEventType, HttpHeaders, HttpRequest } from '@angular/common/http'; @Component({ selector: 'app-fetch-data', templateUrl: './fetch-data.component.html', changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush }) export class FetchDataComponent { public forecasts: WeatherForecast[] = []; public encodedResult: string | undefined = ''; public streamedResults: string[] = []; constructor(http: HttpClient, @Inject('BASE_URL') baseUrl: string, private readonly cd: ChangeDetectorRef) { http.get(baseUrl + 'weatherforecast').subscribe(result => { this.forecasts = result; }, error => console.error(error)); this.getEncodedStreamed(); } public buildingResult() { this.encodedResult = this.streamedResults.join(""); } public async getEncodedStreamed(): Promise { const response = await fetch('https://localhost:7141/EncodeBase64?textToEncode=abcd', { allowHTTP1ForStreamingUpload: true, } as any); if (response.body == null) { throw new Error('Not possible in current scenario'); } const reader = response.body.getReader(); const streamedResults = this.streamedResults; const encoded = this.encodedResult; const cd = this.cd; async function printStream(): Promise { const { done, value } = await reader.read(); if (done) { return; } const textDecoder = new TextDecoder(); const stringValue = textDecoder.decode(value); encoded?.concat(stringValue); console.log(stringValue); streamedResults.push(stringValue); cd.markForCheck(); await printStream(); } await printStream(); } //private async function printStream(reader: ReadableStreamDefaultReader): Promise { // const { done, value } = await reader.read(); // if (done) { // return; // } // const textDecoder = new TextDecoder(); // const stringValue = textDecoder.decode(value); // console.log(stringValue) // await printStream(); //} } interface WeatherForecast { date: string; temperatureC: number; temperatureF: number; summary: string; }
